segments.text: I notice the overwhelming calmness of the woman at the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She seems to be in her own world, polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Yet chaos brews around her, and she remains blissfully unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water spills over the sink, creating a small lake at her feet, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It frustrates me how she can’t see it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And then there’s the boy, climbing in a way that makes my heart race.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My breath catches as I watch him reaching for the cookies with that precarious balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl’s hand is raised, innocent, as if she’s beckoning something magical to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like an accident is just waiting to unfold right before my eyes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I doubt the woman even knows they’re stealing cookies; the tension is palpable.
segments.speaker: PAR
